intro: Lecostomon macrophyllum, commonly known as the broadleaf lecostemon, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its large, showy leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. Its foliage is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive appearance and ease of cultivation. Lecostomon macrophyllum is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
